question: In which nation "Walls of Ston" is located?
explanation: Walls of Ston is one of the longest preserved fortification systems in the world located in Croatia. It is a series of defensive stone walls constructed during the 14th to 15th centuries. Limestone was used for its construction. It was meant to protect the salt pans of Dubrovnik, Croatia. The Walls of Ston were known as "Europe's Wall of China".
